item.title: Hello_world
item.description: One of the most famous piece of code used to introduce novice to programming languages The first known version of the program written by Brian Kernighan is found in a tutorial to the language B main(){ extrn a,b,c; putchar(a); putchar(b); putchar(c); putchar('!*n'); } a 'hell'; b 'o, w'; c 'orld'; Followed by its language C version #include <stdio.h> main( ) { printf("hello, world\n"); } And written in the same language as the universe (Source)
